title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When attempting to create a new class using the new class wizard in build 20011106, the 'Enclosing Type' field is not populated correctly when a .java file is open in the editor. The field should default to the current type in the editor, but it appears blank instead.
OB: Open a .java file in the editor. Open the new class wizard and navigate to the 'Enclosing Type' field.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field should display the current type of the file open in the editor by default.
SR: Ensure that the 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard is populated correctly with the current type of the file open in the editor.
